source.description: Prepare conjugation plate

Autoclave
of 1.6% agarose solution (in MQ-H2O)
Incubate autoclaved bottle/flask in
waterbath

Pipette
mL of N-free ASW (Artificial Sea Water) into 250 mL flask
Add
LB media
Add
NaNO3 (880uM)
Ad
NH4Cl (880uM)
Incubate ASW+LB in
waterbath
(or until agarose has acclimated to 50oC)

Once both solutions have reached
, pour the agarose into the ASW flask in the PCR hood to maintain sterility
Continuually mix in flask until mixed thoroughly

Pipette
of ASW (0.8% agarose, 5% LB) mix into each well
Avoid bubbles on plate by pipetting up 10 mL while only dispensing 8 mL
During incubation, place 2 6-well culture plates (flat bottom) in a PCR hood

Solidify and dry plates in PCR hood
During, prepare P. tricornutum cells
Obtain an axenic culture of Phaeodactylum tricornutum (CCAP1055/1) growing in exponential phase

Determine culture health by Fv/Fm measurement using Dual-PAM fluorometer
(Exponentially growing culture typically has a Fv/Fm value of 0.6 to 0.7)

Collect enough culture volume for 6e8 cells (total)
Calculation:
P. tricornutum at concentration of 5e8 cells/mL per well
12 wells X
=
(5e8 cells/mL) --> 6e8 cells
Ex:
P.t. concentration = 1.1e6 cells/mL
6e8 (cells) / 1.1e6 (cells/mL) =
*** I round up to
***

Measure cell concentration
(Ideally by flow cytometry side scatter (SSC) vs. FL3 (longpass filter, 570nm)
Pellet cells

Remove supernatent with graduated pipette-man so to not disturb pellet
Add cells to 2 2mL tubes
Pellet cells again
Remove supernant with pipette

Add 100-200 uL NO3-ASW to one 2 mLtube and mix cells with pipette
Mix all cells together in 1 tube
Add appropriate volume of NO3-ASW to cells to bring final volume to

source.title: Prepare E. coli for conjugation transformation

source.description:
Ensure to include positive and negative controls
Positive (conjugation episome containing a RFP bacterial expression cassette)
Negative (conjugation episome that confers resistance to nourseothricin antibiotic, in contrast to resistance to phleomycin)

Do not seal tube with cap. Rather, place cap on tube loosely and secure with tape

source.title: Prepare E. coli for conjugation transformation

source.description:
For each conjugation reaction, pipette
E. coli culture on top of P. tricornutum cells in the middle of the well.
Mix the E. coli culture very well with a pipette prior to dispensing in well.
Spread E. coli in an orbital motion (refer to video) for each well (do not wait until all 6 wells have E. coli to spread, spread after every dispensing)

source.title: Prepare E. coli for conjugation transformation

source.description: Dry E. coli on top of P. tricornutum cells (10-20 minutes)

The conjugation mechanistically operates when the E. coli are exposed to an optimal growth temperature and for a certain duration.
P. tricornutum is most competent to conjugation at
After all E. coli have dried, wrap each plate with breath-easy tape

Incubate 6-well plate at
and in the dark

source.title: Scrape Phaeodactylum cells off conjugation plates

source.description:
After 48 hrs, collect P. tricorntum cells in 2 mL tubes
Remove conjugation plate(s) from incubation and put them under a PCR hood, take off lid to start drying plate(s)

source.title: Scrape Phaeodactylum cells off conjugation plates

source.description:
Obtain ASW media supplemented with both NO3 and NH4
Prepare 2mL tubes to collect scraped cells
I recommend using a hockey stick styled cell scraper. It allows more control of scraping in a small well area

source.title: Scrape Phaeodactylum cells off conjugation plates

source.description:
For each well...
Pipette
media and gently scrape off cells with a hockey-stick shaped cell spreader
*** DO NOT USE A LOOP ***
Collect cells with a P1000 pipette
Repeat once

source.title: Scrape Phaeodactylum cells off conjugation plates

source.description:
Mix collected cells very well with pipette
Place tubes at
for
During 1 hr incubation, dry P. tricornutum selection plates

Selection Plates:
For each conjugation reaction, prepare 3 selection plates (100mm x 15mm culture plates) with 35 mL media each
Ex: Prepare
of plate selection media (enough for 1 6-well conjugation plate, 18 plates)
1. Autoclave 325 mL 1.6% agarose
2. Incubate at
after sterilization
3. Incubate
ASW supplemented with
NaNO3 and
NH4Cl, also at
4. Thaw Phleomycin stock (100mg/mL) and chloramphenicol (20 mg/mL)
5. Pour agarose into ASW flask and mix
6. Add
Phleomycin (50 ug/mL final concentration) and
Chloramphenicol (10 ug/mL final concentration) when temperature of ASW/agarose falls below
7. Pipette
selection media into each culture plate
8. Dry under PCR hood for
9. Store at
until needed
Dry selection plates under a PCR hood for at least
Pipette 300 uL of collected P. tricornutum cells per plates
Spread on plate with cell spreader (or loop is fine here)
Dry cells on selection plates and seal plates with breath-easy tape

Incubate selected P. tricornutum at
for at least 10 days or until dark circular colonies begin forming.

description:
Bacterial-conjugation methodology used to introduce the CRISPR-Cas9 episome generated using the GG2 assembly protocol.
This method, though, can be adapted for any episomal transfromation from an E. coli culture that contains a cargo plasmid (episome) and conjugation plasmid (pta-MOB) to Phaeodactylum.
